intro: Hieracium catognense, commonly known as the Italian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and basal leaves that are lanceolate in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with ray florets surrounding a central disk, and it produces small, rough seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium catognense is often found in meadows, grasslands, and along roadsides, thriving in temperate climates.
